result.execSummary:
The defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $150.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11/07/2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dezmen Lamon Veasy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $150.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11/07/2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton appearing via telephone.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing, however, atty Shelton is unable to appear for today's hearing. Case adjourned in branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing hearing, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates on the felony matter.  This case to return to Misdemeanor Court, Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Zachary A Wittchow for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Plea hearing.  Parties still engaged in negotiations.  Defense attempting to provide the state with clarifying information as to defendants' prior offense.
Defense request for adjournment heard and granted by the Court.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Danielle Chojnacki for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time for possible drug treatment court.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing on 15CF4477.  Defense requests projected guilt plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.Defense requests case transferred to branch 22 to resolve with felony matter. Branch 22 approved transfer. This court approves transfer. Case adjourned to branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  The defendant has an arrest warrant in a pending felony matter.  The defendant was taken into custody on the warrant.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised and the court notices that the defendant is visibly ill.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel received discovery and offer. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy in custody.  
Student Intern Matt Adrian under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  


Case was currently assigned to Judge Konkol due to Co-defendant Felony case, however, co-defendant is in warrant status. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Pretrial conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 1:30pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dezmen Lamon Veasy not in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  9-1-2015 at 1:30pm
